weka.distributed.spark

Class WekaClassifierEvaluationSparkJob

  • java.lang.Object
    • distributed.core.DistributedJob
      • weka.distributed.spark.SparkJob
        • weka.distributed.spark.WekaClassifierEvaluationSparkJob
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, weka.core.CommandlineRunnable, weka.core.EnvironmentHandler, weka.core.OptionHandler, weka.gui.beans.InstancesProducer, weka.gui.beans.TextProducer

    public class WekaClassifierEvaluationSparkJob
extends SparkJob
implements weka.gui.beans.TextProducer, weka.gui.beans.InstancesProducer, weka.core.CommandlineRunnable
    Spark job for running an evaluation of a classifier or a regressor. Invokes up to four separate jobs (passes over the data). 1) Header creation, 2) optional randomly shuffled data chunk creation, 3) model construction and 4) model evaluation. Can perform evaluation on the training data, on a separate test set, or via cross-validation. In the case of the later, models for all folds are created and aggregated in one pass (job) and then evaluated on all folds in a second job.
    Version:
    $Revision: 12253 $
    Author:
    Mark Hall (mhall{[at]}pentaho{[dot]}com)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getSampleFractionForAUC

        public java.lang.String getSampleFractionForAUC()
        Get the percentage of predictions to retain (via uniform random sampling) for computing AUC and AUPRC. If not specified, then no predictions are retained and these metrics are not computed.
        Returns:
        the fraction (between 0 and 1) of all predictions to retain for computing AUC/AUPRC.

      • setSampleFractionForAUC

        public void setSampleFractionForAUC(java.lang.String f)
        Set the percentage of predictions to retain (via uniform random sampling) for computing AUC and AUPRC. If not specified, then no predictions are retained and these metrics are not computed.
        Parameters:
        f - the fraction (between 0 and 1) of all predictions to retain for computing AUC/AUPRC.
